faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What is company liquidation and deregistration in the UAE?
items.answer: Company liquidation is the legal process of closing a company, settling all debts, cancelling licences, and deregistering with the UAE Free Zone or Mainland authorities to cease operations formally.

items.question: How long does the liquidation and deregistration process take?
items.answer: The duration depends on your company type (mainland or free zone), outstanding liabilities, and regulatory approvals. Typically, the process can take anywhere from 4 to 12 weeks if all requirements are in order.

items.question: Will I be liable for penalties if I close my business incorrectly?
items.answer: Yes, failing to deregister your company can result in costly fines, accumulated license renewal fees, VAT penalties, and even restrictions on future UAE business activities.

items.question: What happens to employees during liquidation?
items.answer: All employee visas must be cancelled, and final settlements, including end-of-service benefits, must be completed in accordance with UAE labour laws.

items.question: Can I start another business in the UAE after liquidation?
items.answer: Absolutely! Completing company liquidation and deregistration properly leaves your record clean, allowing you to launch a new company or invest without restrictions.
